text: Kinetta railway station () is a train station in Kinetta, West Attica, Greece. It is located just north of the town, adjacent to the A8 motorway. It was opened on 27 September 2005 as part of the extension of the Athens Airport–Patras railway to Corinth. The station is served by Line 2 of Proastiakos Athens between Piraeus and Aigio. It has two side platforms and a large "park & ride" car park. ==Facilities== The Station has waiting rooms. The raised station is assessed via stairs or lift. The station is staffed, with ticket purchasing facilities and toilets. It as has parking. ==Services== The station is currently served by Line 2 of Proastiakos Athens between Piraeus and Aigio. ==Line layout== ==References== Category:Railway stations in Attica Category:Railway stations opened in 2005
title: Kinetta railway station
